public interface

YouTubePlayer

com.google.android.youtube.api.YouTubePlayer
Known Indirect Subclasses
YouTubePlayerFragment, YouTubePlayerSupportFragment, YouTubePlayerView
YouTubePlayerFragment A fragment which displays a YouTube Player View. 
YouTubePlayerSupportFragment A support library fragment which displays a YouTube Player View. 
YouTubePlayerView A view for displaying YouTube videos. 

Class Overview

This interface defines methods for loading and playing YouTube videos.

Summary

Nested Classes
interface YouTubePlayer.OnFullscreenListener Interface definition for a listener that is invoked when the player toggles between fullscreen on or off, either due to the user clicking the fullscreen button or a call to setFullscreen(boolean). 
interface YouTubePlayer.PlaybackEventListener Interface with definitions of callbacks invoked when video playback events occur. 
interface YouTubePlayer.PlayerStateChangeListener Interface with defintions for callbacks invoked when high level player state changes. 
interface YouTubePlayer.PlaylistEventListener Interface with definitions for callbacks invoked when events related to playlists occur.

int FULLSCREEN_FLAG_CONTROL_SYSTEM_UI Flag for setFullscreenControlFlags(int) to enable automatic control of system UI.
int FULLSCREEN_FLAG_FULLSCREEN_WHEN_DEVICE_LANDSCAPE Flag for setFullscreenControlFlags(int) which causes the player to automatically enter fullscreen whenever the device enters landscape orientation.

Constants

public static final int FULLSCREEN_FLAG_CONTROL_ORIENTATION

Flag for setFullscreenControlFlags(int) to enable automatic control of the orientation.

The behavior is to force landscape orientation when entering fullscreen and and switching back to the original orientation setting when leaving fullscreen. The implementation will also exit fullscreen automatically when the device is rotated back to portrait orientation. This should generally be set unless the application is locked in landscape orientation.

Constant Value: 1 (0x00000001)

public static final int FULLSCREEN_FLAG_CONTROL_SYSTEM_UI

Flag for setFullscreenControlFlags(int) to enable automatic control of system UI.

When set, system UI will be hidden when user interaction is not expected and re-shown simultaneously with the player controls whenever the user interacts with the device.

The system UI includes the status bar if it is visible as well as any other bars that may be present on the device (navigation bar, system bar etc).

If the application is showing an ActionBar, it is shown and hidden simultaneously with the player's controls and other system UI on user interaction, provided that the action bar was created as an overlay using Window#FEATURE_ACTION_BAR_OVERLAY. Otherwise, it will be hidden for the duration of the fullscreen session.

Constant Value: 2 (0x00000002)

public static final int FULLSCREEN_FLAG_FULLSCREEN_WHEN_DEVICE_LANDSCAPE

Flag for setFullscreenControlFlags(int) which causes the player to automatically enter fullscreen whenever the device enters landscape orientation. This flag requires FULLSCREEN_FLAG_CONTROL_ORIENTATION to also be set.

Note that setting this flag will always cause the screen orientation of your activity to be switched to landscape whenever the user rotates the device to landscape orientation, even if you have specified that your activity should be locked in portrait (in your application's manifest or using Activity.setRequestedOrientation(int)). On exiting fullscreen the screen orientation will be reset its original value.

Setting this flag is useful if your application only has a portrait layout, but would like to enable fullscreen playback in landscape orientation when the user rotates the device.

Constant Value: 4 (0x00000004)

Public Methods

public abstract void cuePlaylist (String playlistId)

Cues the specified playlist, but does not download any of the video streams or start playing until play() or seekToMillis(int) is called.

Parameters
playlistId The YouTube video id of the playlist to be cued.

public abstract void cueVideo (String videoId)

Loads the specified video's thumbnail and prepares the player to play the video, but does not download any of the video stream until play() or seekToMillis(int) is called.

Parameters
videoId The YouTube video id of the video to be cued.

public abstract void cueVideos (List<String> videoIds)

Cues a list of videos, but does not download any of the video streams or start playing until play() or seekToMillis(int) is called.

Parameters
videoIds A list of YouTube video ids to be cued.

public abstract void enableCustomFullscreen (YouTubePlayer.OnFullscreenListener listener)

Enables custom fullscreen behavior when fullscreen mode is toggled, either by the user clicking a fullscreen button or by a call to setFullscreen(boolean).

The default fullscreen behavior will layout the video player in fullscreen and automatically control both orientation and system UI without requiring additional support. However, this default behavior requires rebuffering of the video when switching to fullscreen and back. To avoid this, developers are advised to handle the fullscreen event themselves by calling this function.

An application implementing custom fullscreen behavior must ensure that the player's view takes up the whole available space of application's window whenever onFullscreen(boolean) is called. Typically this can be done by setting the visibility of all other views to View.GONE and setting the width and height of the YouTubePlayer to MATCH_PARENT. You should also make sure to specify that your activity handles configuration changes that may occur when toggling fullscreen, including orientation, keyboardHidden and screenSize. The YouTubePlayer will continue to control both orientation and system UI automatically. If you wish to control orientation changes and system UI manually, call setFullscreenControlFlags(int).

Parameters
listener The listener to be notified of fullscreen toggling.
See Also
  • setFullscreenControlFlags(int)

public abstract int getCurrentTimeMillis ()

Gets the current elapsed time of the playing video relative to its start.

Returns
  • The current elapsed time (a number of milliseconds) of the playing video relative to its start. The result is only well-defined after the video has finished loading.
See Also
  • onLoaded(String)

public abstract boolean hasNext ()

Determines whether the currently loaded playlist has a next video.

Returns
  • true if there is a next video in the loaded playlist, false otherwise.

public abstract boolean hasPrevious ()

Determines whether the currently loaded playlist has a previous video.

Returns
  • true if there is a previous video in the loaded playlist, false otherwise.

public abstract void loadPlaylist (String playlistId)

Loads and plays the specified playlist.

Note: YouTube only counts playbacks that are initiated through the native play button.

Parameters
playlistId The YouTube playlist id of the playlist to be played.

public abstract void loadVideo (String videoId)

Loads and plays the specified video.

Note: YouTube only counts playbacks that are initiated through the native play button.

Parameters
videoId The YouTube video id of the video to be played.

public abstract void loadVideos (List<String> videoIds)

Loads and plays a list of videos.

Note: YouTube only counts playbacks that are initiated through the native play button.

Parameters
videoIds A list of YouTube video ids to be played.

public abstract void next ()

Plays the next video in the loaded playlist.

Throws
NoSuchElementException if called at the end of the playlist.

public abstract void pause ()

Pauses the currently playing video.

public abstract void play ()

Plays the currently cued / loaded video.

Note: YouTube only counts playbacks that are initiated through the native play button.

public abstract void previous ()

Plays the previous video in the loaded playlist.

Throws
NoSuchElementException if called at the start of the playlist.

public abstract void release ()

Stop any loading or video playback and release any system resources used by this YouTubePlayer.

Note that after calling this method any further interaction with this YouTubePlayer is forbidden. A new instance must be created to re-enable playback.

public abstract void seekRelativeMillis (int milliSeconds)

Seeks forward or backwards by the specified number of seconds.

If the player is paused when the function is called, it will remain paused. If the function is called from another state (playing, video cued, etc.), this method will play the video.

Parameters
milliSeconds Number of milliseconds to seek forward, if positive, or backwards, if negative.

public abstract void seekToMillis (int milliSeconds)

Seeks to the specified time in the video.

If the player is paused when the function is called, it will remain paused. If the function is called from another state (playing, video cued, etc.), this method will play the video.

Parameters
milliSeconds Time to seek to in milliseconds.

public abstract void setFullscreen (boolean fullscreen)

Inform the player that it is being laid out fullscreen. Calling this function may affect the looks of the player's controls, e.g. showing an option to enter or exit fullscreen, changing the layout to better suit the current player size etc. Note: Calling this function will cause any registered YouTubePlayer.OnFullscreenListener to fire off a onFullscreen(boolean) event.

Parameters
fullscreen true if the player is fullscreen, false otherwise.

public abstract void setFullscreenControlFlags (int controlFlags)

Controls the behavior when fullscreen mode is toggled.

This method allows you to disable the default control of device orientation and system UI on fullscreen events. The flags specified here apply to both default and custom fullscreen implementations. The default is that FULLSCREEN_FLAG_CONTROL_SYSTEM_UI is set, and FULLSCREEN_FLAG_CONTROL_ORIENTATION is set if your activity handles orientation changes.

See enableCustomFullscreen(OnFullscreenListener) for details on implementing custom fullscreen behavior.

Parameters
controlFlags Bitwise-or of FULLSCREEN_FLAG_CONTROL_ORIENTATION and FULLSCREEN_FLAG_CONTROL_SYSTEM_UI. 0 to disable any control. The flags specified here applies to both default and custom fullscreen implementations.
See Also
  • enableCustomFullscreen(OnFullscreenListener)

public abstract void setManageAudioFocus (boolean manage)

Specifies whether or not the player will handle audio focus as part of it's playback lifecycle.

When true, the player will request and abandon audio focus appropriately when playback starts and ends, as well as pausing playback when losing audio focus. When ducking, the player lowers its volume.

Handling the audio focus also includes pausing the player if necessary when the audio is becoming noisy due to a change in audio outputs (see ACTION_AUDIO_BECOMING_NOISY).

The default value is true.

Parameters
manage true to enable automatic handling of audio focus, false to disable.
See Also
  • ACTION_AUDIO_BECOMING_NOISY

public abstract void setPlaybackEventListener (YouTubePlayer.PlaybackEventListener listener)

Registers a YouTubePlayer.PlaybackEventListener.

Parameters
listener The listener to register, or null to unregister the previous listener.

public abstract void setPlayerStateChangeListener (YouTubePlayer.PlayerStateChangeListener listener)

Registers a YouTubePlayer.PlayerStateChangeListener.

Parameters
listener The listener to register, or null to unregister the previous listener.

public abstract void setPlaylistEventListener (YouTubePlayer.PlaylistEventListener listener)

Registers a YouTubePlayer.PlaylistEventListener.

Parameters
listener The listener to register, or null to unregister the previous listener.

public abstract void setShowControls (boolean show)

Shows or hides the controls overlayed on top of the player.

Parameters
show true to show the controls, false to hide them.
